H0.text: More stable is what a neutral atom becomes when it gains or loses electrons.

H1.text: An isotope is what a neutral atom becomes when it gains or loses electrons.

H2.text: An ion is what a neutral atom becomes when it gains or loses electrons.

H3.text: Less charged is what a neutral atom becomes when it gains or loses electrons.

A4.text: An ion is an atom or molecule with a net electrical charge.

A5.text: The process of gaining or losing electrons from a neutral atom or molecule is called ionization.
